sub_title: GIS & Remote sensing specialist - Lecturer/Researcher at ITC, University of Twente
summary:
I am a geographer with a MSc in Geo information science for natural resources management from ITC, University of Twente where I am presently working as a lecturer and researcher. 

A passionate of my profession, I have completely dedicated the last years to my field of study and particularly Geographic Information Systems, developing and modeling different ways to apply these fabulous softwares and techniques to the understanding and management of different geographical spaces and topics: from social problems related to accessibility to education facilities to crop identification or production estimation. I have vast experience in developing and managing geodatabases, ground truth data collection and quality assessment and visualization techniques both for desktop and web-based services.

I have an excellent educational background which is marked by Cum Laude diplomas for both my BSc and my MSc degrees. Also, I have large experience both as a researcher and consultant geographer on GIS and remote sensing as well as good expertise in developing teaching material and delivering training courses in international environments. Furthermore, I am fluent in English, French and my native Spanish and have a good knowledge of the Dutch language   

Please feel free to contact me for further information if you think I could be a good profile to join your project. I am always willing to be involved in new challenges.

Kind regards to all

Lucas DE OTO

projects:
[{'title': 'CCI-KE', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'The consequences of a warming climate are far-reaching and are already affecting the atmosphere, land and ocean, and altering the main cycles governing the Earth system. With impacts on the natural environment and society for generations to come, climate change is high on political, strategic, and economic agendas worldwide.

To prepare for this challenge, ITC, under the Climate Change Initiative (CCI) and Knowledge Exchange project (https://climate.esa.int/en/), has developed Educational Resources which are learning materials for educators, students, and the interested public. The educational resources target three categories', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Lucas', 'last_name': 'De Oto', 'name': None, 'headline': 'GIS & Remote sensing specialist - Lecturer/Researcher at ITC, University of Twente'}]}, {'title': 'SEED4NA', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': 'The SEED4NA project aims to: 1) develop the required knowledge, skills and competencies on SDI & EO within partner universities; 2) help introducing modern SDI & EO courses in engineering and agriculture/forestry studies; 3) implement supporting VET programmes; 4) help partner universities to support the development of SDI in their country and 5) promote a European approach to SDI & EO. SEED4NA will result in the establishment of capable, well trained pools of experts within academic institutions which will introduce in their turn a modern approach in academic and VET education on SDI & EO in their respective countries, thereby becoming promotors of SDI development and EO use.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Lucas', 'last_name': 'De Oto', 'name': None, 'headline': 'GIS & Remote sensing specialist - Lecturer/Researcher at ITC, University of Twente'}]}, {'title': 'EO4SD - Agriculture and Rural Development project', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'EO4SD – Agriculture and Rural Development project – aims at demonstrating the benefits of EO-based geo-information products and services to support agricultural monitoring and management tasks, in particular projects and programmes of the Mulatilateral Development Banks (MDBs) such as World Bank, Inter-American Development Bank, IFAD and Asian Development Bank which deal with land degradation, soil erosion, food security and irrigation systems management.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Lucas', 'last_name': 'De Oto', 'name': None, 'headline': 'GIS & Remote sensing specialist - Lecturer/Researcher at ITC, University of Twente'}]}, {'title': 'Earth Observation & GIS - Course at CuriousU Summer School - Univeristy of Twente', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'The course will cover the fundamental aspects of land spatial modelling and combine aspects of Geographic information systems and remote observation simultaneously, with the support of an integral and intuitive software-free package. The course will be delivered during the CuriousU Summer School. The CuriousU experience is a one-of-a-kind combination of a summer school and a festival. Our summer school package includes: academic courses, music, sports, theatre, inspirational speakers. We’ve got it all. The last  edition of CuriousU in 2016 was a huge success with participants from 40 countries! Check out CuriousU and get inspired.
https://www.utwente.nl/en/education/summer-school-curiousu/?gclid=Cj0KEQjwldzHBRCfg_aImKrf7N4BEiQABJTPKO6g5krvf35VpX6yh8dlbwl0FMwmvDKl5UzzMyRaXV4aArEI8P8HAQ
', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Lucas', 'last_name': 'De Oto', 'name': None, 'headline': 'GIS & Remote sensing specialist - Lecturer/Researcher at ITC, University of Twente'}]}, {'title': "IDERA - Argentina's SDI", 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': "The Argentina's Spatial Data Infrastructure (IDERA) is a geospatial information community whose objective is to promote the publication of data, products and services, in an efficient and timely manner as a fundamental contribution to the democratization of access to the information produced by the State and various actors, and support in decision-making in the different activities of the public, private, academic, non-governmental and civil society spheres.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Lucas', 'last_name': 'De Oto', 'name': None, 'headline': 'GIS & Remote sensing specialist - Lecturer/Researcher at ITC, University of Twente'}]}]
